Diagnosis: Acute Cardiac or Pulmonary Condition (e.g., Arrhythmia, Pulmonary Embolism) Justification: The mention of a racing heart and difficulty breathing warrants consideration of primary cardiac or pulmonary causes. While these can cause systemic symptoms, the presence of fevers and gastrointestinal symptoms makes an infectious or systemic inflammatory cause more plausible; these cardiac causes would be secondary or complications rather than primary in this scenario.
